senses.sense_definition: The theological doctrine that the body and blood of Christ are locally and materially present in the Eucharist under the form of bread and wine.

examples.text: The theologian argued that the concept of <w>subpanation</w> fails to explain the mystery of the sacrament adequately.
Critics of the doctrine of <w>subpanation</w> believe it places too much emphasis on the material presence within the bread.
